intro: Desmodium rubrum var. macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-seeded burr legume, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It features trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces distinctive, spiny, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. The plant is often found in moist, disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in full sun to partial shade. Its rapid growth and ability to fix nitrogen make it a valuable plant in ecological restoration projects. The species is also noted for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique seed pods.
